newsitem.title: USA: Disney to add Orlando animation building.
newsitem.headline: Disney to add Orlando animation building.

text.p: The Walt Disney Co. said Friday it would build a 200,000 square-foot four-story building to house animators at its Disney World theme park complex near Orlando.

"In just seven years, Walt Disney Feature Animation Florida has more than quadrupled in size and expects more growth in the near future," feature animation President Peter Schneider said in a statement announcing the project.
The new building will be constructed next to an existing cartoon studio and will house more than 400 cartoonists and support staff by summer 1998, the company said.
Disney has an existing cartoon staff here of abut 360, now working on "Mulan", an animated movie based on a 2,000-year-old Chinese folk tale.

A spokeswoman for Disney declined to detail the costs of the new building, designed by Sandy & Babcock Inc. of Miami and described as "reminiscent of the orginal feature animation studio on Disney's Burbank lot designed by Kem Weber in 1940 for Walt Disney."
